questions.question: Which system do most digital currencies rely on for processing payments and transactions?
Digital currency works like regular money but is exchanged __________ between computers over the __________.
Digital currency can only exist on computer systems and cannot be converted into physical cash.
What is the most frequent method used for digital currency payments online?
__________ is the protection of personal or sensitive information from being accessed by unauthorized users.
When making a digital currency payment, the data is made safe by being:
The HTTPS protocol is responsible for handling the encryption used in digital currency payments.
A persistent cookie is a small file stored on your device that remembers your payment details for future visits.
What was cryptocurrency designed to solve?
Unlike normal digital currencies, __________ transactions are not managed by central banks or governments.
All cryptocurrency transactions are kept private and cannot be tracked by the public.
What makes cryptocurrencies often considered more secure against tampering?
Who manages cryptocurrency transactions according to the text?
A __________ is a decentralized database where each transaction is stored with a timestamp and linked to the previous one.
How must changes to a blockchain record be approved?
options: Approval by a consensus of users on the network.
questions.answer: Approval by a consensus of users on the network.

questions.question: Blockchain technology is used only for cryptocurrency transactions.
The very first block in a blockchain is called the ______.
If someone changes the data in a block, it automatically updates the hash and the link to the next block remains valid.
The ______ method requires a fixed amount of time and effort before a new block can be added to prevent fast tampering.
In the context of blockchain, who are "miners"?
options: Network participants who verify transactions and add new blocks for a reward.
questions.answer: Network participants who verify transactions and add new blocks for a reward.

questions.question: When a new block is created, it is only sent to the miners for verification before being added.
What does a new user joining the blockchain network receive?
options: A full copy of all existing blocks.
questions.answer: A full copy of all existing blocks.

questions.question: In a blockchain transaction, a single block can only ever contain one transaction.
When a new block is created, it is sent to all computers in the network, which __________ that the data is correct before the block is added.
Each member of the blockchain network stores a different copy of the transaction records.
What happens if someone tries to change the data in a blockchain block?
options: The system automatically corrects the error
Only that specific block becomes invalid
The hash alters and breaks the link, invalidating the chain from that point onward
The transaction is reversed to its original state
questions.answer: The hash alters and breaks the link, invalidating the chain from that point onward

questions.question: New users joining the blockchain network only receive the most recent blocks to save storage space.
